question: In which Anglo-Mysore was, Britishers defeated by Marathas?
explanation:
In the First Anglo-Maratha war (1775-1782), the British East India Company was defeated by Maratha Army. Then, the Treaty of Salbai (1782) was signed. As per the treaty-
a) Madho Rao Narayan recognized as the Peshwa.
b) Salsette and Bassein were given to the British.
c) A pension of Rs. 3 Lakhs per annum given to Raghunath Rao by the Poona Government.
d) Restoration of al Maratha territories occupied by the British from the treat of Purandhar.
d) Britishers recognised the territorial claims of the Mahadaji Sindhia west of the Jumna River.
